section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Abuse" has the meaning stated in § 4-501 of the Family Law Article.
"Cohabitant" means an individual who has had a sexual relationship with another individual with whom the individual has resided for a period of at least 90 days.

"Victim of domestic violence" means an individual who:
has received deliberate, severe, and demonstrable physical injury from a current or former spouse or current or former cohabitant; or
is in fear of imminent deliberate, severe, and demonstrable physical injury from a current or former spouse or current or former cohabitant.

text.section: If an insurer acts in good faith, the insurer is not subject to tort liability for a cause of action arising from the insurer's lawful issuance of and lawful compliance with a policy of life insurance on an insured who subsequently suffers abuse or is a victim of domestic violence.

This section does not require an insurer:
to make a payment to an individual who willfully caused an injury that gave rise to a loss under a policy of life insurance; or
to issue, without the consent of the proposed insured, life insurance or disability income insurance to an applicant known to have abused the proposed insured.

This section may not be interpreted to preclude an insurer from using mental or physical medical conditions, regardless of cause, in determining the eligibility, rate, or underwriting classification of the applicant or insured.
